title: Cheap but cheerful
review: This is an older small hotel. It is cheap but the staff are helpful and friendly.   A good 10-15mins walk to main attractions but an easy walk.   Near the train station, about 10mins. Not worth a taxi if your physically well, but it can be tricky to find as the internet map has it marked wrong.  Head for the American cafe and ya just 10meters up from there!

title: Great location and good overall
review: We stayed for 3 nights in a Quadruple room. The room was fairly dimly lit but spacious. The beds were fine but the aircon didn't feel like aircon and was more like cold air. There was a large cupboard in the room but not loads of storage space. Luckily we weren't staying that long. The breakfast was good and a wide variety of cereals and ham and cheese and bread etc. There wasn't much seating room so it must get packed when they are fully booked. The location was good walking distance from Florence Train station and close to the main sights. There are also supermarkets nearby which is nice. Would return again purely for the location and price.

title: Jail Break
review: The positives of this hotel are:   •Comfortable bed with good linen •Nice towels  •Very quiet and dark (our window opened to the pipes and conduit of the next building over, less than a meter away). •There were two nice staff who were friendly and helpful. The others seemed a bit blasé (understandably, I guess!) •Consistent aircon which wasn’t too loud or cold. •Close to Mercato Centrale, which was fabulous for food and drinks and people watching.  On the downside: •In a seedy area, drunks passed out near hotel entrance, dodgy types all around.  •Some terrible cafes and restaurants in close proximity. •Very disappointing breakfast selection with possibly the worst coffee I’ve ever tasted. We didn’t bother eating here after the first morning.  •Whilst comfortable, the bed was two single beds side by side, which slipped easily across the floor. •Dirty and dated, shower pressure and temp was good but dingy and dark, with gross shower curtain.  •Extremely loud buzzing for entry into the room - think prison cell style.   We are pretty positive people and like to make the most of our short time together, so we definitely made light of the situation and had a lot of good laughs 😂 A bit of comedic imagination can do wonders 😂  We would definitely not stay here again, though.…

title: Good value hotel. Confirmed: rooms facing Via Nazionale are noisy.
review: This hotel is very good value. Very close to the city centre, clean and the staff are very helpful. Our room was on the first floor and facing Via Nazionale and indeed it was noisy, I do not understand it, because I think it had double windows, but still, I could hear the traffic. And I am a bit hard of hearing, so I do not usually complain about the noise. Nonetheless, for the price, I think it was a great deal.

title: Better than average and well situated to the train station
review: Last minute changes to your itinerary are often challenging, if not impossible!  Changing our destination to include Florence, we scrambled to find a hotel.  After calling a couple of hotels listed in a guide book, we found a room at the Galileo.  Likely much more grand in the past, everything about our stay was satisfactory. The hotel staff was very welcoming and very helpful. They offered to store luggage if you arrive before check-in or hold after check-out time. The desk manager helped us with train schedules, provided maps and directions. All of the staff was very accommodating and friendly.   Our room was clean and everything in the bathroom was in working order.  Breakfasts were buffet-style and included all of the usuals, coffees, teas, meats, cheeses, pastries/breads, cereals, etc.   The hotel has an elevator and is only a few blocks from the train station. The Duomo was an easy walk, perhaps 4 blocks, one turn and a couple more blocks to it and the Campanile (bell tower). There are places to eat near the hotel and a small convenience store en route to the Duomo.  I've noticed some negative reviews, but our experience was in line with most 2-3 star hotels in Europe.…

title: Don't stay here!
review: Stayed for 3 nights. Only amenities in Bathroom were 1 small hotel bar of soap, Towels and toilet paper. No Facial tissues. Strangest flush arrangement on toilet I have ever seen. In room safe was so small it was a joke; couldn't even get an iPad mini in it. Lock jammed on minibar fridge would not open and called for service. Later the guy at the desk tried to charge us for the repair said we broke it. We did not force it. Told them what to do with the repair bill. To be fair the hotel has excellent location; walking distance to almost everything. Included breakfast was minimal very little selection. Would not stay here again.

title: Not great
review: Room not clean, lights didnt work,   breakfast was very poor.  Shower overflowed. The staff were helpful at the desk Overall, I would never go there again this was our 4th hotel in Italy and the worst. Its only redeeming feature was it was 5 minutes walk from the metro and station

title: Nice looking hotel but ordinary service and conditions
review: This hotel looks great and is ideally located in Florence.  However the conditions inside leave a bit to be desired.  Firstly the night noise from the corridors and neighbouring door locks is excessive.  Next, mosquitoes in the room cannot be tolerated and the bedding was not comfortable.  All in all a very ordinary experience.

title: A little disappointing!
review: We have been travelling through Italy staying at mid range hotels but this would have to be at the bottom of the range. Firstly the positives: Great location, close to the old city, railway station, cafes and shops The staff were fabulous- concerns were addressed immediately, as much as they were able to e g all 3 electrical outlets in our room were not working so we couldn’t charge our phones or iPads, and they organised for an electrician to come and do so within a few hours. However the cleanliness of the room was not great, cupboards could not be opened, curtains were very dirty and the towel rack, electric, was inside the shower where it got wet. Very concerning. Gave a new meaning to a quick shower. It had enormous potential to be really good but was underwhelming to say…

title: Decent place with a weird bathroom!!
review: Decent,clean, 3 star hotel. It has a lift,Thank heavens!!  Decent room, rickety cupboard,though!! It has the weirdest bathroom I have ever seen!!! I wonder who designed the configuration!! In the land of ancient masters of Churches and Palace builders,this is laughable and shameful!!  Look for yourself and judge!!  My husband and I are of very average height!! 5 feet 4inches max and we still had difficulty using the toilet so I wonder what would happen if anyone big and tall were to use it!!!

title: A well-located hotel
review: The hotel is set close to all the sights of Florence. It is also close to the airport and the central station. The staff is kind. The rooms are large and comfortable. There is free internet. Breakfast is good and well balanced.

title: Weekend of culture and fun with family.
review: Cannot say anything negative about this hotel. The location is fantastic. A 6-7 minute walk from the train station along a bustling street. Because my sister and I have young children, ages 10 and 4, we were given a suite with an adjoining door. Wasn’t sure at first but each room was very large and we had our own bathroom. Only negative of having this room was it is positioned directly next to the breakfast area, so scraping chairs from 7:30 not so good. Lovely staff. Helpful and accommodating. Made Mum a pot of tea late one night. Had a really positive experience here. Our party of 10 all said their rooms were clean and comfortable. I would definitely recommend to friends.

title: Great hotel in beautiful city
review: I stayed at this hotel with my daughter. It is a short walk from train station and close to main sights in Florence. The room was clean and had everything we needed. There was a noisy fan on when we arrived but asked for it to be turned off and didnt have any other problem with it. Breakfast was included and there was a good choice of food available. The staff were very friendly and helpful especially Stefano who went above and beyond to help us. All in all a lovely stay in a beautiful city.

title: Brilliant hotel for city break in Florence!
review: This hotel had everything we needed. It was in a great location- right by the train station and within an easy short walk of all the main attractions. The staff were very friendly and helpful; from booking us taxis, advice on where to go and discounts on places to eat. The hotel is in a great spot for evening food and drinks choices. This hotel was very Clean which is a must for me.  Great hotel. We would highly recommend.  Thank you for a lovely stay.

title: A nice surprise!
review: The hotel we had booked had a mix-up for the first night of our 3 night stay in Florence.  We were escorted to the Hotel Galileo and were pleasantly surprised.  This hotel excels in "charm" - just in case you are looking for sleek and modern.  We could have easily stayed here all 3 nights.  The room was larger than we expected, staff was friendly and extremely helpful ( got us last minute reservations to Accademia), Wi-Fi worked great for us, and despite being on a very, very busy street, our evening was quiet even with the window open.    I would not hesitate to recommend based on our one night there.  Thank you, Hotel Galileo for being what you are, a gracious, comfortable, charming boutique style hotel in the middle of a very chaotic part of Florence!

title: Average to not impressed
review: Hotel is in great position. Although: the bed has steel springs sticking through it, the WiFi was intermidant and the city tax is far too expensive for what we experienced. Plus side they cater for gluten free breakfast and majority of staff are very friendly.

title: Average hotel
review: When arriving in our non smoking room, it smelt like a smokers area in a bar.. unsure of whether it was connected to a smoking room? But if we left the windows shut, Every time we returned, the room was full of cigarette smoke smell.   Other than that, the hotel it’s self is nice enough, I can’t even remember what we paid to stay there! The breakfast option is pretty poor in relation to other places we stayed on our trip of Italy. Just some jams and bread to choose from!   The beds are small in a double room, literally just a double bed, which is rather uncomfortable.   The hotel has wifi, but you’re better off not using it. It’s constantly drops out every minute or so..  Over all, I wasn’t very impressed with the hotel, but it is in a good location.

title: Looked after us well...
review: A last minute booking and we found this very pleasant hotel in a central location that will accept a dog. They were helpful with the parking arrangements we required and to provide us with a good sized double room and nice bathroom facilities. Thank you to Vincenzo for his assistance. The continental breakfast was particularly nice.

title: Nice surprise
review: I was in a low budget trip but was extremely well surprised with the hotel. Good internet service, very comfortable rooms, nice location. Everything clean an good for a good price. I realy recommend to stay there.

title: Quite a good place to stay
review: We just spent the night here but I found it to be quite good.   Four important things to me are location, a firm bed, air conditioning in the room and a good shower with decent water pressure and this hotel ticked all the boxes here.   It’s nothing fancy but I was happy with my stay here and I’d stay here again.

title: Great Location
review: Stayed in this small hotel recently for four nights, close to the station. 20mins. walk to all the main sights. Good Breakfast and helpful staff, our room at the back was a good size and clean. Could be noisy at the front as it is on a main road. Bars and restaurants near by and it was a reasonable price considering its central location.

title: Great Location
review: We stayed here for 3 nights great hotel except for their WiFi which was constantly dropping out which made it hard to book tours online. Great location walking distance to everything from the markets to the Duomo & Ponte Vecchio. Breakfast was great if your on a budget this is a great place to stay.

title: Everything in walking distance
review: Very close to the main station and very close to the sightseeing highlights, we were happy to get a hotel for a reasonable price in Florence. Very small front desk, but friendly personnel (especially the asian guy) we were happy to get our room already in the morning. The view out of the room was to a backyard. The advantage was the quietness in the night. The room was clean, the bathroom as well, nothing to complain.  Breakfast was  italian like, so a lot of sweet things. Don’t expect a typical continental breakfast. Coffee from the machine was very good.  If the wardrobe would have been in a better shape and the room itself would have had a nicer interior, I would have given more points. Nevertheless, because of the price for the room and the location i can recommend it and…

title: Excellent hotel with decent budget
review: The hotel is just 10 mins walk from the station. located on the main road. walking distance to Uffizi, Duomo,Galleria and you name it. the Staff are very courteous and helpful and provided us with lot of tips on sightseeing. the breakfast spread is also good. rooms are big and spacious and so is the toilet (frankly in our entire Europe trip, this had the largest room with toilet). We really enjoyed our stay.

title: Great Location
review: The hotel is clean and neat with very friendly staff. Nothing a problem. Close to train station and several supermarkets in the street. Free wifi and free breakfast. Everything available within walking distance.

title: Great location. Friendly staff
review: The location of this hotel is easily walked to and from the main train station. Everything is an easy walk around this beautiful city. The accommodation is quite rudimentary and simple however it is great value, very clean and the room itself is quite spacious. Breakfast is basic however the cafe next door is very good.

title: ideal location,great value
review: Three of us staying for four nights as a base to see sights and then head to the rugby in Rome on the Sunday. Ideal location as 10 minutes walk from the train station and 10 minutes walk to the town centre (less than 5 minutes to the Central Market & one of the main museums & only 15 minutes to the other side of the river). Loads of bars & restaurants nearby including a great craft beer bar (Mostoldoce) about 20 yards away. Adequate breakfast, nice clean rooms & good size bathroom. Good value. Also 90 minutes by train to Rome & 60 minutes to Pisa. The staff were lovely and I'd definitely stay there again.

title: A quick weekend
review: The location is really good, close to the station and 10.min on foot to the centre. The downside was an hour and half of delay for the check in. The room was clean but not so equipped. The staff very gentle. We didn't have breakfast. In short, Not so good to make me come back next time.

title: suitable stay for Coeliacs
review: We stayed here in early December and found the location was ideal for our short break in Florence.It was about 10 minutes by foot from the railway station and in an area where there were plenty of bars and places to eat.Also really only a short walk to main sights.The rooms were comfortable enough,nice and warm and the bathroom perfectly adequate ,very clean,with nice fresh towels daily.The breakfast was continental style but with enough choice to keep us going til lunch time.I had emailed in advance to say I was a coeliac and although no bread was provided I did well enough with the yogourts fruit,and cold meat etc together with nice coffee and juices.I was able to purchase gluten free items locally but it would have been nice to have had a roll provided instead of me using my…

title: Not bad
review: I stayed at the Galileo hotel for 2 nights. Overall it is a decent little hotel. The staff is wonderful and they serve a really good complimentary breakfast.  A few observations: The rooms are on the small side The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from the Duomo and the main tourist area If you ask, the front desk will give you a coupon for a 10% discount at a good restaurant right around the corner  It's about a 10 minute walk to the hotel from the Santa Maria Novella train station, which is where most visitors arrive in Florence You have to insert your key card into the outlet by the door in order to keep the lights on. (We rarely see this in an American hotel.)

title: Great hotel
review: This hotel is in an excellent location. Close to sights, train station, tourist meeting points, local markets, city squares, cafes, restaurants etc.  Staff were very friendly, helpful and welcoming. Reception was able to book tours. Wifi was excellent strength. There is a lift that services all floors.  Breakfast has a good selection for a continental breakfast including fresh espresso coffee.  Our room was absolutely huge! It could of fitted at least eight queen size beds in the room. Bathroom was similarly large. It is decorated in old Italian style - for us this was all part of the charm, but this is not for everyone.  It can be a bit noisy as people come and go from their rooms. But we did not experience any street noise as our room was at the opposite side of the hotel.  We…

title: Central location is the asset
review: We stayed here for two nights. The positive of this hotel is that it is walking distance from the train station, amongst the city centre cafes and restaurants, close to the laundromat and free wifi.   The negatives are the rooms are very small and dated, tiny shower, tiny tv, loud buzzer to enter your room which you can hear everyone else's go off, you can hear people walking up and down the hallway, loud reoccurring toilet system, on a very busy noisy street, no air conditioning and unwelcoming reception staff.  If your after a centrally located hotel and okay with putting up with the negatives than this is the place for you.

title: Great location
review: We loved this hotel! It is in a great location very close to train station, laundromat, Santa Maria Fiore, and San Lorenzo Market. Great breakfast with several options and attentive staff having espresso waiting. The front desk staff was also very friendly and helpful and the tours that they offer were great.  It was a little loud outside the window at night but that was expected with a room with a street view and in an active part of the city.

title: Value for money
review: we had two rooms. hotel in 12 to 15 min walk from the train station walking distance from all the local sight seeing attraction. there are lot of local cafes and restaurants near the hotel, just in the lane next to the hotel. there is indian restaurant just two min walk from the hotel. Rooms are very functional and have window that can be opened. Rooms are not very spacious.

title: Great location
review: It has been a pleasure staying at this hotel for 4 nights , the location is great on Via Nazionale a couple of minutes walk from the train station and to major tourist attractions. Breakfast was the usual cereals , juice,... Cappuccino of course. On the other side, there was a mishap with the A/C so got a fan instead and a discount for the room , that was a nice move from the staff. Definitely a nice hotel for a stay in Firenze.

title: Karen S
review: Location was excellent as close to train station and not far from popular tourist attractions. Rooms clean . Breakfast was the usual cakes and cereal and fruit - would be nice to add option of eggs. Buzzers on doors very loud and annoying as was noise in the hotel as walls very thin - could hear the gent in next room using the toilet. Reception staff not especially welcoming and did not help with luggage. Definite room for improvement.

title: Great Service and location
review: It has been a pleasure to stay at this hotel for four nights. The man on the desk was so helpful with leather purchases, places to eat, and he even sorted out a tour that had been booked for the wrong day and time so we could still go. A marvellous location Thoroughly enjoyed our time here and thanks so much for all your help

title: Good Location & Large Room even for a family of 4
review: Rooms are large compared to Italian standard. Stefano at the reception was very helpful and the lady in the breakfast table was very charming & caring even though she was the only person to take care of the guest breakfast. The location is good and if you speak to Stefano he would help in planning the place to visit.

title: Unfriendly staff and poor rooms
review: Noisy room, no hot water on second day. Unfriendly staff ( lady looking after breakfast didn't smile once and just grunted and pointed) when asked if we could have a beer at the bar we were told that was what the mini bar was for! Would not recommend staying there even though ideally suited for main attractions. Decor is tired .

title: Gorgeous rustic hotel, well located
review: Gorgeous rustic-style hotel, decked out with wooden furniture, vases of flowers and the cutest little breakfast dining room you've ever seen! Very friendly and helpful staff, and really well located, walking distance to the train station, the popular museums, piazzas, shopping, food etc. Can't go wrong with this little gem... it is situated on a busy street so traffic noise was a little loud in the rooms, didn't bother us as we slept pretty easily after a big day!

title: A nice stay in the heart of Florence.
review: The rooms are actually pretty big for Italy...bed was a bit stiff, but not bad.  Rooms were clean, and the included breakfast was good.  You're a short walk from downtown and the Duomo, the Florence Market, and the staff was very informative.  Also very close to the train terminal.  Good for a short to mid term stay.

title: A Wonderful Hotel
review: Stayed here for 2 nights, from check in to check out, everything was smooth. The rooms are very nice and comfortable, wifi is excellent.  Hotel staff are very friendly, and go out of their way to make you feel comfortable.   All the sights of Florence are at a walking distance, and 7 mins walk from the main train station.   Would definitely recommend this hotel to all.

title: Barely acceptable
review: What's good: Room size,we were five, the room had an appropriate size.  The beds are comfortable. Staff was friendly. Location is good, 5 min walk to train station walking distance from main attractions. What's fair:  Everything seems old including the building. Cleanliness very superficial. Breakfast not so good. No ventilation in bathroom. What's bad:  Very noisy.  We could hear the people in rooms around us, the plumbing is very noisy you hear when people open water faucets or flush the toilet.  You hear cars and people outside. In summary barely acceptable.  I would not return.

title: Lovely place
review: Good area. About a 10 minute walk to the Duomo. Staff were lovely. Room was basic but I suppose you get what you pay for. Also in prime location to the train station as it's on the main street (Via Nazionale).  Only problem we had were that we were woken up by ridiculously noisy neighbours who decided to was a good idea to 'practice' opera at 7AM and then at 9PM until late. We reported this to reception and the elderly gentleman didn't really seem bothered and told us there was nothing he could do.

title: Comfortable and Reasonable
review: We planned a quick trip to Florence to explore the city. Hotel Galileo is a short walk from SMN train station and located close enough to the center of the city. It is conveniently located on an avenue with many shops and bars for all of your needs. The staff was extremely accommodating and considerate. We were able to check-in early, access to free Wi-Fi that actually works, and free breakfast/brunch which included a wide selection of fresh fruit, croissants, meat, cheeses and beverages to choose from. The room itself was a standard double room with enough space and also a closet which included additional blankets, etc. Everything was clean and comfortable.

title: Enjoyed our stay!
review: This hotel really suited us. The location is brilliant- 10 minutes walk from the train station and all the main sights. Staff spoke good English and were helpful and friendly.  The room was very spacious for a European city hotel and also very clean. Bed was comfortable. Small TV with a few English channels. The bathroom was clean and big and there was a powerful shower, always with hot water. I Didn't ever get up in time for breakfast so can't comment on that.  My only slight complaint is the noise the key card opener makes - it's really loud and can disturb you in the night. There is also some noise from outside as the hotel is on a busy main road. I would absolutely stay here again when I next visit Florence - good hotel and good value for money.

title: Good Hotel, Lovely Staff
review: We stayed here last week and were very happy. The hotel is only 10mins walk from the train station and about the same from the Duomo. The room we had was comfortable and had a good bathroom and a little balcony with a small table and two chairs. The breakfast was good, although there weren't so many things to choose from.  The staff were very helpful and professional. At night the noise from the other rooms was a bit much, but it stopped once they all went to sleep.

title: A Good Choice!
review: The hotel was conveniently located to all attractions as well as the train station,  The hotel was clean and the staff was very helpful.  The breakfast was simple but good.  We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Galileo.  We  would recommend this hotel to friends.

title: Convenient and clean
review: A convenient, clean, and good value hotel. The welcome was friendly and helpful. The free breakfast had sufficient variety for most tastes. We visits a restaurant around the corner, I Toscano, which we can also recommend for a tasty and expensive meal.

title: Very ordinary
review: This hotel is possibly the worst hotel I have stayed in. Although check in was a pleasant experience it was downhill from here-on in. Firstly the lift...the most disgusting smell ever..it did not get better over 5 days. Secondly, the noise...when you can stand in the corridor and hear conversations from within nearby rooms speaks volumes for privacy. Every time people in the next room went to toilet you heard it. Loud electronic door openers that woke you up if the next door room came back late at night. The street noise ...unbearable. check out my photos of how the bed was presented after make-up, how the towels are presented in the bathroom and dirty used glasses not replaced or the plastic bottle and cup not removed, toilet paper in the bidet not removed. This is not a nice…

title: Florence break
review: Not far from station, extremely helpful staff. My friend and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. it was small but was clean and breakfast adequate, I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again if I went to Florence.

title: october in florence
review: we stayed at the galileo hotel for four nights, at begining of october 2016, some would say the decour was a bit tired, for us it was just right, it gave an atmosphere of old florence, room was clean ,shower worked well , the hotel is central and easy walking distance to most attractions, reception staff friendly and helpfull, continental breakfast was good, may be busy in july august, not a big dinning area, overall good value for money, note: you have to pay city tax on your stay, taxi to airport was 24 euros, train station to rome or venice is only 10 minutes walk, there is a shuttle bus from train station to florence airport for about 5 euros each.

title: Cute Hotel
review: Good staff I really like interior of the hotel of the room nice and sweet. Rooms were BIG I loved my room very sweetly done in pink old style with very cute look. Staff was also good location is brilliant extremely close to the railway station walking distance I must say and close to the market and restaurants. It’s a definite yes for everyone to stay and according to European standards rooms were luxurious.

title: Near train station (that's all).
review: The only good thing is that this hotel is near train station, super tiny room and bathroom, old furniture,old accessories at bathroom, employees are just ok .. doing their job, the guy at the reception will give you basic information and will not take any extra step to answer further questions, barely  meets expectations, place is good enough for a sleep only. Over priced. You can find better places with better prices.

title: 5 days in Florence
review: The hotel is within easy walking distance of the train station and pretty close to all of the main sites as Florence is a pretty compact city. The hotel was clean, comfy enough, not too large, great location and the staff were very helpful. As a solo traveller it suited my needs perfectly.

title: Affordable accomodation
review: The Galilleo Hotel is located central to the most sight seeing places in Milan. Recommendation to nearby restaurants were spot on, as it was mostly visited by locals. Room clean and comfortable. Breakfast is enough to get you going for the day. Will return and recommend the hotel for budgeted travellers which want value for money

title: Very decent 3star, convenient location
review: Very decent 3star,  great price to quality ratio. Convenient location - close to the train station and walking distance to the hip on hop off bus terminal stop and most sightseen places. Full-sized room and bathroom, Good breakfast. Highly recommend, would stay again.

title: Great stop-over in Florence
review: We spent ohne Night in Florence and had a Double room in the Galileo Hotel. Staff was extremely friendly, room was super clean and comfortable, parking was easy around the corners as it was weekend - overall great stay in this small but sweet Hotel.

title: Probably the best choice to stop in Florence on budget
review: We found this hotel with a help of TripAdvisor. It was late, we were tired, our BIG mistake was to go to Florence by the car. Never do this :) Tried several hotels in a range of 2 miles city center. This one was the best: friendly staff, clean, comfortable rooms, really good prices. If i will come to Florence once more - i will stay at this hotel for sure.

title: An abundance of moths
review: Truly. Every time we opened the one armoire in the room, one or two moths flew out. At least my kids sort of enjoyed chasing them down. I just hoped we wouldn't bring any home with us.   Although a good location, close to the train station and the fantastic Mercato Centrale, it was almost impossible to find. In part that's because of the street numbering which starts and stops multiple times between the train station and the hotel. Just note that it's likely a good bit further down the street than you thought it would be. In fact, when I stopped in a tattoo parlor to ask where it was (after trying a restaurant and other hotels), I found someone else in there asking the exact same thing! Perhaps a marketing campaign to let the neighbors know where it is would help.   As other…

title: Convenient area for shopping
review: I have to be honest it was bit of drive from the station when i arrived and at night i was bit worried thinking about area but i had to say i was wrong. The hotel staff was great and helpful. The station was actually walking distance when i return back and all shopping areas and attractions were close by.  It s mid range hotel for budget trips but definite  place to check out!

title: A good three star hotel
review: Our travel agent recommended this for us.  Our room was small, so small one cannot sit at the desk while another walks between the person at the desk and the bed.  The bathroom has no counter space.  Wifi is free, but it can come and go.  The beds are comfortable.  The fridge is small and keeps things cool, not cold.  There is almost no closet space.  Hot water is plentiful, though the pressure fluctuates.  No wash cloths were provided.  The towels are large and absorbent.  The gentleman staffing the desk was cheerful and full of good advice on things to do.  He recommended a tour that we thoroughly enjoyed.  He also made the reservation and arranged for us to be picked up at the door to the hotel.  The location is about a ten minute walk from the rail station.  The market is a…

title: Very friendly staff!
review: Very friendly staff who are always willing to help with any information we needed. They were always willing to supply us with what we needed! Even some tea at night! This hotel is walking distance from the train station and from the central markets and museums. A great little hotel!

title: Rustic beauty in the heart of the City
review: I chose this hotel because of its location near the train station. The hotel had cute rustic charm. Being in the heart of the city it wasn't really very peaceful but didn't made a big difference. After sightseeing for the entire day I anyway slept like a log. Room was clean.

title: Good location and large room
review: 2 nights at The Galileo Hotel. Our room was quite large and airy and the decor was cute. Upon checking in we were given discount vouchers to 2 restaurants in the area. We went to both over our 2 nights there and found them both to be great recommendations. The shower was a little difficult as it was hand-held and there was no shower curtain but it was in a good sized bath so that was always an option. If we had more time to spend running a bath I'm sure it would have been lovely. The location is good as it is a 10 minute walk to the train station and a short 15 minute walk to the street stalls where you can buy all the dubious leather products you could want. Our departing train was later in the day so leaving our luggage with them after checking out was a handy option and freed…

title: Great location
review: This hotel is in a great spot. It's close to markets 3 minutes away, the academia gallery and duomo are also close by and if don't mind about a little extra walking only 10/15 minutes away from the main shopping streets.  Also close is a supermarket, laundromat, lots of restaurants and buses and trains.   Although it is quite and older hotel so the bed was not the best and the bathroom really squishy, it was clean.   It also had air conditioning, not the best however we found closing the shutters throughout the day helped to keep the room cool.

title: Clean basic hotel in good location
review: Well located near train station and car parking. This hotel had smallish rooms, bed was Ok, bathroom in need of a refit, silicon repairs all over. Double glazed windows overlooking street OK to reduce noise while the air con was working. Florence doesn,t appear to sleep. Breakfast basic continental with adequate choice , not much room to move when busy.Easy walk to all attractions around Florence and very close to nice restaurants and markets.

title: Rustic and charming hotel
review: Stayed at this hotel in June , small but adequate bedroom with a lot of rustic charm . The room was cleaned each day for the week we stayed , clean towels , bedding each day . Nice sized bathroom . The breakfast was basically a continental breakfast , which we found more than adequate , plenty of coffee ,tea, juice , it was a good start to the day . It suited us perfectly , has eating out in Florence is one of the pleasures of this beautiful city . We found that the staff were very helpful , and really gave us good idea's about where to go in and around Florence ,. A great hotel clean and tidy , and the location was perfect for the bus and train station , just 10 minutes walk , basically walking distance to everything you need to see .

title: Not For Us
review: Very disappointed. We would not have rated this hotel 3 stars. The bed was hard, the pillows were hard, the water to the room was very smelly and a communal toilet abutting our room may as well have been inside our room. The noise from the street outside was all encompassing (air conditioning was off and needed the window open for air) and the staff were aloof.  We will go elsewhere next time.

title: Ok hotel, unpleasant staff
review: The hotel was maybe a 2-star hotel. Room was small and the sink leaked in the bathroom. No screen in window, so when the cleaning staff left the window open, I came back to flies buzzing around the room. When asked for assistance at the front desk or in their breakfast lobby, the staff were not helpful and very unpleasant.

title: Bella Bella
review: The Hotel is a fairly easy walk from the train station, even with my large luggage in tow.  Very clean and the front desk staff spoke enough English to make the stay much more enjoyable.  They were able to recommend great places to dine and gave great directions.  Close to the open market for your shopping needs.  A definite stay the next time I go to Florence!!

title: Girls weekend away
review: Firstly, the reason we decided to book this hotel was for it's excellent reviews on the location, which was great. However, there are a huge amount of hotels within this area which will be of similar price. The hotel is small, typical Italian decor. Breakfast was fine, nothing amazing. Only had a small selection of cereals, croissants and toast. Staff were nice, were always willing to help when possible. The bed sheets were changed daily, however the cleanliness of our hotel room was appalling, we soon realised this after walking around without shoes on. I have attached a picture of my friends feet to show you just how bad this was. The floor was marble, and had clearly not been mopped in a very long time. Also, on checkout, we had to pay a fee of 6.50 euros per person for city…

title: Very nice hotel
review: I really liked this hotel. The location is perfect with busy restaurants, markets and other places of interest nearby. The train station is also only a short walk away. The room I had was nice and clean, spacious and had a very comfortable bed. The hotel has wifi but unfortunately I couldn't get it to work in my room. A very basic cold breakfast is provided but it is good enough to kick start your day. The staff are friendly and helpful and I have enjoyed my short stay. Oh and Florence is an amazing city.

title: A perfect hotel!
review: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights as a city break with my Mum. It's a quaint hotel with friendly staff. It is perfectly located - a 5 minute walk from the main train station and a 5 minute walk from the very heart of the city!  The room was very cheap and the staff are all incredibly nice and helpful. They were able to tell us which sites were open on which days, where to get the best deals and how to get to places. The breakfast has cereal, bread and cheese, tea and coffee, cakes, yogurts, fruit - anything you'd want.  The room is quaint and well kept - we stayed overlooking the Via Nazionale and as soon as you close the window there's no sound!  I could not recommend this hotel more. We will definitely be returning!

title: Early season trip with friends
review: To set off the travel season, we, (a group of 8 friends), traveled to Florence/Firenze. This was a 5/6 day trip. We stopped in the Galileo Hotel which is in the center of Florence, handy for restaurants, attractions and shops.

title: Good location
review: The hotel is in a good location, within walking distance of many of the attractions in Firenze and close to the main station and bus station. The rooms were comfortable and clean, staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast was adequate but no hot food.

title: Good location, nice hotel
review: Located not far from the centre, this hotel offers a lot for its cheap prices: included breakfast (which is quite small but everyone should find something that satisfies their appetite), large bathrooms, 24/24h reception, etc... Additionally, the rooms were clean and spatial. I would recommend this hotel for people who don't want to pay much for their stay but still care about clean rooms, who don't care about not having a modern interior design and who don't want to walk a lot to reach the centre of Florence.

title: Handy Hotel with good facilities and service
review: We stayed here with a small group of students who had just finished their final exams. The rooms, facilities and included breakfasts were of 4 star standard. The location is excellent - close to all major attractions and train station. Staff were friendly and very helpful.

title: Disappointed
review: The Galileo Hotel Via Nazionale 22A 50123 Firenze  Disappointment   Located close to Stazione Centrale, S M Novella (Florence Central Railway Station),  with walking time of about 10 mins. Close to it is the central attraction of Florence, S Maria Del Fiore (Duomo). Except for the location , nothing much can be written about the hotel. The interiors appeared to be in very depressingly vintage condition with dirty and discoloured walls in dire need of a fresh coat of paint.  With dimly lit corridors and rooms, crammed up washrooms, (just imagine the predicament of Fred Flintstone or Obelix), mirrors with smudged glasses( more like antiques from Galilean era), the hotel offered a rather somber and austere breakfast fare. Two single mattresses on a double bed were quite…

title: Worth a look!
review: We stayed at Hotel Galileo over the past four days and loved it.  The hotel is ideally located within a five minute walk from the train station and the city centre so no need for long walks to get to any of the amazing restaurants or sights that Florence has to offer.  The hotel is very quaint and typically Italian. There are no airs or graces to the place but it offers you everything you would need. The room we stayed in was small but with a huge window looking out onto the road outside you didn't feel closed in at all and actually made you feel that the room was very airy and bright. The breakfast on offer was very European but adequate to set you up for the day but leaves you with just enough room to be able to indulge in a gelato or some street food.  Definitely worth a look…

title: Good Location In Florence
review: The rooms were clean an comfortable but  small. The hotel is a short walk from the train station and all sights. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, good breakfast in the morning. Good value for the money and would stay again when in Florence.

title: Clean, comfortable & close to station
review: This was my 1st solo visit to Florence and I needed a place to overnight. When my taxi stopped outside the hotel I initially had some reservations about the area but once I entered I was pleasantly surprised. The check in was prompt and the man on duty spoke English and offered me a city map and explained the surroundings. The furnishings in the room looked old but everything worked and it was quite spacious (especially the bathroom). My view was the back of the hotel and there was a terrace if I wished to climb out the window. The hotel and my room was spotless. The breakfast was a cold buffet (typical European with breads, cheeses, cold meats & cakes and some fresh fruit). I had some time that afternoon and the next morning to explore the town and found that everything was…

title: Cute hotel,  nice area
review: The hotel has an old world charm to it and is pretty cute. The rooms were a decent size, but the bed wasn't the most comfortable. It wasn't bad and I slept fine, but I've been comfier. The breakfast was okay, there weren't a ton of options. I don't eat a lot for breakfast, but if you have a big morning appetite, you might have trouble filling up. The hotel is in a good area, about a 10 minute walk to the train station and lots of little restaurants lining the street. Overall, it's a good place for the money, and I would likely stay here again.

title: Helpful Staff in Florence
review: Central location, clean and reasonably comfortable. Breakfast just average but reception staff absolutely outstanding! So handy for the Central Market and Palazzo Medici Ricardi. Also within walking distance to the train station and Teatro Del Sale. Any query was met with friendliness and efficiency. We had all our tours booked within minutes.

title: Perfectly Located in central Florance.
review: This was my first ever European trip and did not have anything to compare as far as European hotels. The location was wonderful, it is close to everything in Florance. We stayed in a double room and quarters were very cozy. 2 single beds pushed together and no room to separate them. Thankfully my roommate and I got along well and didn't mind sharing a sleep space. Bathroom also very tiny with a pedestal sink toilet and shower stall.room had a small tv however only 2 non English stations came in. Hotel has wifi but you need to be in lobby for strong enough signal to really use it. The breakfast in the morning was good. Assorted cheeses and meats. Coffee and pastry.  The hotel is clean and comfortable and staff is very nice. I would go back if ever in Florence again.

title: Lovely stay
review: Excellent location in central Florence. The staff are all very friendly and give great service. When we arrived they even went over a map of Florence with us, telling us of the best places to visit, best places to eat and drink etc.  The hotel is very quaint, with lots of traditional Italian furnishings and all the communal areas are very well equipped and clean. The bedrooms themselves are exceptionally clean and more than large enough. There is plenty of wardrobe space and the shower is great, with plenty of hot water. There are lots of options from the mini bar, and its all reasonably priced.  We couldn't get a picture on our TV, just the accompanying sound, but how long does anyone watch TV for in Florence?! Our bed was comfortable, but it was actually 2 single beds pushed…

title: Wonderful stay
review: Well located hotel. Near the central market. Very nice reception staff. The only minor problem was that the airconditioning was programmed & not adjustable in the room. The breakfast was nice and we were able to reserve cooking classes, taxis & restaurants at the desk.

title: Perfectly acceptable
review: Large room and bathroom that where functional if basic. For its rating and price I think it was good. I could find fault if I had wished but the bed was comfy and the breakfast pretty good and the rest of the time in Florence was spent exploring. I would use this hotel again. It is handy got the city and the train station.

title: Very nice room, centrally located hotel with excellent serivice from the Front Desk
review: Arrived at this hotel on a 3 city package tour of Italy with my 16 year old daughter. (I don't usually do package tours but Thomas Cook in Farnborough, Hampshire surpassed themselves on the itinerary!!). I had booked a Walking Tour through Florence online and had to confirm that I was still doing it on the day booked so I asked the Front Desk to confirm for me. Stefano and Francesca worked through their morning/afternoon shifts whilst manning the front desk, to arrange another tour after it turned out that my online booking had not been booked! A very nice breakfast with good, strong coffee. This hotel is 10 minutes walk to/from the main train station, ideally located to Florence city centre (10 minutes walk), certainly a hotel I would revisit if I am in Florence again.  Our…

title: Short stay
review: The hotel was quite atmospheric and reasonably comfortable.  The room was a decent size, the furniture was a little worn, but clean and fresh painted walls. It was very hot whilst we stayed but the air-con did keep the room comfortable whilst being slightly noisy. I would have liked a slightly higher level floor room guessing it might have a better view than just the street. The bath room had bath tub, big plus for me ! The WiFi could be a bit on / off but on the whole was ok. Typical continental breakfast which was adequate.  Location was great, easy walking distant from the train station, into the city easy in just a few minutes walk.  The staff were extremely helpful in sorting out our return transport.  We would consider returning, if in Florence as it was adequate for out…

title: Needs maintenance but good location
review: We stayed as family of 4 in quad room 108, 1st floor back of hotel. The room was spacious enough for our short stay however a few minor items detracted from our stay.  The aircon only just coped with the hot days and the room had no direct sun on it so the street side rooms must have been hot. The wifi is useless anywhere in the hotel. There was a bath, no proper shower refer photo, there is a hand held shower head attached to the tap but nowhere to hang it up high. Breakfast is basic continental and is a crowded affair.  On the plus side staff were helpful, room was clean and the property well located.  Would we stay here again, NO

title: Old rooms, poor wifi, bad air conditioning
review: Stayed in this hotel during July. The location was perfect, an 8 minute walk from Santa Maria Novella station.  The rooms are old, we asked for 1 king bed but got 2 singles aligned side by side. The air conditioning in the room was very bad. Had to call the reception many times but without luck. The wifi was so poor, it couldn't load a basic homepage.  The toilet flush of our neighbors could be heard in our bedroom. Not to mention the construction works early morning.  Extremely disappointed. Would not recommend & definitely not come back again.  Been to better places with similar rates & ratings but the experience was way better.

title: Great location, great staff, great place to stay
review: Stayed in this hotel several times and never disapoints.  Great location to central market, nice breakfast and very accomodating staff.  Rooms are clean and great for travelers.  The elevator is small like most European hotels, so plan ahead or take the steps (hard with luggage!).  Would go back again and again.

title: All in all a good experience
review: Not initially impressed but by the time our stay was over, came to appreciate its finer points. Great location, staff, and cleanliness. I've had better breakfasts but was good enough. Great recommendations were given for restaurants and train station was short walk away. A reasonable and comfortable experience.

title: Good location,clean and comfortable
review: We stayed here as a family of 4 and found the room comfortable and clean. The location was good , within walking distance of shopping, cafes, supermarkets and nearby laundromat.  Staff very friendly and helpful.

title: Good location but very slow internet
review: Location is close to major sight seeing places and short walking distance from main train station.  Breakfast is good and room is clean.  Only negative point was that internet was very slow and on the second night during our stay, there were no internet at all.

title: One day atay
review: Very poor quality of sleep, bad mattres condition, noisy room coming from the constant traffic. This hotel should be avoided if possible, location and proximity to the main city center is the only asse.

title: Close to everything
review: Like most hotels in florence it was handy to everything including the station, restaurants, markets etc. Basic accommodation but had everything you would require for the cost. Reception staff were very helpful. Basically if you want more plush surroundings then you have to be prepared to pay more.

title: Avoid this seedy place.
review: It's in a rundown section of the city. The rooms (our room, anyway) are small and cramped. We had a problem with the toilet that was not fixed. I asked, reasonably so, for fresh bath towels on our second day and was snootily told "5 star hotels change the towels every day, we do it every second day." You can't turn on the AC without going through the front desk. Breakfast is a dry, uninspired affair. The only good aspect is a relatively strong wifi.  We're looking for another hotel to switch to before we leave. Save yourselves trouble and avoid the Galileo.

title: Centrally Located
review: Walking distance from the train station, centrally located. Rooms are clean but small and cramped. Everything in the room creaked ; the tables, cupboard doors, the bed. They offered complimentary breakfast, but the spread didn't have many options.  Staff is courteous , friendly and very helpful.   All you need in Florence is a good nights sleep and a centrally located hotel, you'll spend the rest of your time exploring this beautiful city so would recommend this place.

title: Great location & size -Family of 4
review: This hotel had helpful and friendly staff.  The room was a great size for a quad room. ( the best we had in Italy).  Everything was with easy walking distance.  Would recommend this hotel for families travelling with children.

title: Location is the only advantage plus an english speaking reception
review: Location was good for this hotel but room was very small and bathroom even smaller. Rooms linen also is not being changed daily but I guess that is ok. Everything from Piazaalo e signora to the famous river was near. Just walking from Railway station (less then one km.    Breakfast was very basic and again europeon style but not too much stacked. Choose this hotel for location and off course spending night after seeing beautiful florence through out the day.

title: Good
review: The hotel was clean, and the staff was helpful. Breakfast is included in the price, and it was good with pastries, cold meats, and fruit. It is within a walkable distance of the train station and all major sites within Florence. It is right on a main street with thin walls; if you are a light sleeper, you may want to bring ear plugs.

title: Good for limited stay
review: Our agent chose this one because it was both close to the train station and the city sights; in addition we were only staying one night.  The staff was friendly but not helpful when we did not have hot water the night of our stay....reason given: too many guests checking in.  The problem was resolved in the morning...thankfully.  The room was draconian and no temperature control so it was a bit warm during the night.  The breakfast had limited selection but fit the bill.  Our room was ready when we arrived mid-morning so we could store our bag, etc., in the room.  The saving grace was the close proximity to the main sights.  I don't think I would stay here if for more than a night or two.

title: Brilliant!
review: We convenient location! About 10-15 min walk to the train station and everything is relatively close. The 'Italy on a budget' tours company is directly opposite for those wanting an awesome day out! (18-35 ages). The hotel has a buffet breakfast with yummy cakes, toast, cereal, coffee, juice etc (no hot food but still filling). There is an elevator and they also kept my suitcase behind the desk for the day while i was on tour after checking out. Also the hotel is beautifully decorated in Tuscany style with cute rooms and a large window which looked over the street. There was a tv and he bathroom was clean, the rooms were small but not too tiny, overall a very enjoyable stay.

title: Hotel made our trip lovely
review: The hotel itself wasn't outstanding but we didn't expect it to be for the good price we got it for. What did make it amazing was the extremely helpful and friendly member of staff there called 'Adriano'. He made us feel welcome as soon as we arrived, spoke great English and showed us exactly where to go around Florence. The breakfast was also delicious! Would definitely stay again. Feel free to read more about our trip here and what we did in Florence on my blog - http://www.missyred.co.uk/2014/11/florence-things-to-do-and-my-trip.html

title: Pet friendly!
review: We are have a great stay so far.  Convenient location! Easy access to central market and downtown. The breakfast isn't that great but we don't leave hungry. The staff is friendly and eager to help. The wifi isn't the greatest also but I'm sure they would work with you if you had any issues with it.

title: Fantastic
review: After coming from an ok stay in Rome, this place was a breath of fresh air. Friendly staff, quite rooms, location close to everything we wanted. Breakfast was modest but nice. Chocolate brownie cake was best item and the cafe latte was great (just ask the girl downstairs who will make fresh coffee for you). The only problem we had was finding the hotel from the station when we arrived, as the street is not clearly marked and is quite narrow.

title: Torn between good and okay
review: Was set up by our travel agency but we were excited because it was a Rick Steves recommendation. He needs to re-review this hotel.   First off the 3 front desk men were very accommodating. Room was nice and the breakfast was good.  Had read a comment saying no protein but I seriously thought ham to be a protein. Really enjoyed the coffee also.   Now the downsides.  It is an Eco-friendly hotel which is good, but one of their Eco-friendly things is to turn off the air off at midnight and turn on at 6am.   Maybe.... Ours never came back on that morning. When we got back from a long day out sightseeing we had to ask them to turn it on because it wouldn't on its own. Also you have NO control of the aircon - they control it by the computer downstairs.  Had to ask twice for them to…

title: Brilliant service, excellent location.
review: Very traditional hotel only five minutes away from the market and station.  Service was brilliant and very attentive with perfect english.  Breakfast was what you would expect for a small traditional hotel.  Only downside was the air conditioning - went off during the night and needed staff to adjust for you.  Other than that a perfect hotel for a short stay in a beautiful city.

title: Pleasant stay in Florence
review: Our experience with Hotel Galileo this past July 2014 was very pleasant. Stayed three days and did not encounter any of the problems identified in "recently" posted reviews! Rooms were clean, aircon worked well, housekeeping was done every day. Front desk staff friendly and helpful. Hotel is on a busy street, but if you're in Florence for quietness you should find a b&b out in the countryside. We enjoyed our stay!

title: The little things
review: We stayed here for 2 nights recently and on first appearance the hotel was clean, tidy and a good location. It's close to the train station and only a 5 minute walk to a few attractions. The room was a decent size and the hotel had brochures of things to do.  But it was the little things that bought it down. 1. The aircon, was very the noisy the first night and when we asked to have it turned down the second night it was simply turned off. Which meant it got very stuffy and to open the windows meant there was a lot of noise from the street. I couldn't sleep because it was so stuffy and when it was on my partner had to sleep with a pillow over his ears.. Something really needs to be addressed with how much noise it puts out. 2. I know it's normal to have breads etc for breakfast…

title: short break in florence
review: Hotel was situated on a busy road which was quite noisy on a night.Aircon didn't work most of the time and certainly never during the night cause they turned it off.Free wi fi didnt manage to reach our room 120 .although you could get it in the breakfast room and maybe in rooms nearer to there ? Staff on front desk were not unfriendly but not very welcoming either .Breakfast room was far too small and the quantity of food was poor ,they kept running out of things like ham and you had to make do ,it always appeared to be overcrowded with little room to move .It wasn't too far to walk to from the station which is the reason we booked it about 15 minutes,and the Dumo and Uffizi were within easy walking distance ,on a night when it got dark you had to walk through some streets which…

title: I don't recommend this hotel.
review: Good-ish location. Just don't go up to the park 1/2 a block away. You'll come across seedy people taking pharmaceuticals and drinking.   Reception:  - The old Italian guy makes you feel like you should leave as soon as you enter. The Asian immigrant workers were much more hospitable though.   Internet:  - It's free witch is great. Can you use it to load anything? Nope. Can't even stream a basic audio file on YouTube. (I was staying in 103, it's about 3 M away from front desk wall to wall).  Housekeeping:  - Went a full day with no toilet paper, the 2 glasses I had were left in the room, even though they decided they would make the beds. Once the glasses were finally washed, it looked as if they had rinsed them with cold water and wiped them with my towel. Reception claimed that…

title: Great hotel, good value and central
review: Room was very clean and good space. Cool and quiet in spite of busy and hot holiday season. Facilities very good and wifi best I have come across in hotels. Breakfast fresh and adequate. Staff very helpful and friendly. Best thing is how close to centre this hotel is. Close enough to return for a shoe change or rest before the next foray into the very hot weather. Florence felt very safe and is much more relaxed than Rome. Traffic was not a problem but mind the cyclists!

title: BASIC IN EVERY WAY
review: Location central enough but seedy district. Very basic facilities in room although good size. Very basic breakfast with narrow range of food and not enough of it. Very slippery bath. More lodging house than serviced hotel.

title: Fantastic Hotel
review: I booked a family member to stay here for 7 nights recently, and he couldn't say enough nice things about this hotel.  Wifi had great coverage, staff very friendly and breakfast was great.   Great area and located close to the station and within walking distance to main attractions.  3 star hotel and worth the price paid!

title: Average Hotel in a Great Location
review: We stayed for for 5 days with 2 adult children. Location is great.  Within walking distance to the main train station.  Close the shops and.a laundrette.  The room  for 4 was basic and spacious. Good wifi in the rooms The bathroom was spacious but didn't have a shower only a bath which was a little inconvenient. Breakfast was average and coffee was terrible.

title: Miniature but Good
review: Staying in this hotel reminded me of the scene from Harry Potter when the bus had to compact itself in order to fit through the streets of London. Everything is miniature in this hotel: the rooms, the beds, the televisions, the bathrooms, the showers, the breakfast room, the elevator. Nevertheless, if you don't mind wedging yourself and your luggage into the room this is a fine place to stay. This hotel is a hop-skip-and-a-jump all the major sites of Florence, particularly the leather market, the Duomo, the Piazza della Signoria, and the train station. It offers a typical Italian continental breakfast (pastry, cereal, sliced meat, coffee, cake) and friendly staff that is ready to help you with whatever you may need. I would definitely consider staying here again.

title: NO INTERNET
review: I was staying here on a school trip and was relying on the promise of free wifi so that I could contact my parents who were overseas, however, the hotel did not deliver on its promise which caused great problems for me. The room was extremely noisy, hot, and the sink made noise for 20 minutes after you used it. Also, the hotel was better off saving money and not even providing pillows, because the ones they gave were basically a sheet of paper. And, the stairs in this hotel are quite dangerous. Multiple people in my group fell down them, one even badly twisted their ankle, so they could not walk around and enjoy the city. Another problem, is the amount and placement of the outlets. In my room, one outlet was smashed into the wall, leaving us with one functioning outlet, and many…

title: Great Location and Helpful Staff
review: My husband and I stayed for four nights in January 2014 on arrival the room our agent had booked was far too tiny for two. We went and asked if a larger one was available. We were informed one would become availabe next day and if we leave our bags packed they would move us while we were out sightseeing. Next day when we arrived back to hotel we had been moved to a more spacious room.We found the staff very helpful and nothing seemed to be a problem. Comments on breakfast seems a bit harsh seeing it is complimentary it is quite adequate. Our room was always made up for us each day and bathroom was always cleaned. We would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel if we visit Florence again.

title: Fantastic service, great location
review: We stayed here after having a bad experience at a hotel around the corner. The man at reception was very helpful when we arrived showing us around the city on a map and then when we left we had problems with Our train tickets and he called the company and resolved the issue for us. We couldn't ask for a more central location the only reason I couldn't give a 5/5 here was that the wifi had no signal in our room and the shower was a bit annoying because it didn't spray right. If you are just looking for a good 3 star hotel where you have your own comfortable space, stay here.

title: "Great Location, Good service"
review: The hotel has an amazing location. In midst of the city, with lively streets and great restaurants, and all the important places to visit, a stone throws away, it makes the perfect place to stay. The rooms very proper cozy and warm. They were clean and properly set up.  Unlike the previous reviews, we did not have a problem with matters covers or the bedding. It was all, the way they should be. The bathroom was big, though I had a tough time figuring out the way to switch between tap and shower. But that's probably because it was new to me and nothing to do with the hotel. We stayed there during November. We were greeted by warm staff and help was always at hand. Though I can't talk about the breakfast, as we always had them at the many bistros nearby. I would recommend this…

title: Worst coffee in all of Italy
review: How can a country that makes the best coffee in the world serve up this brown gunky dishwater for breakfast? It's that American style stuff that sits on a hotplate in one of those glass jugs and stews away tasting more gross by the minute. And speaking of breakfast - don't bother. We turned up at the specified start of breakfast to find the very cranky staff still setting up. Half an hour later they were still at it and considering breakfast was stale rolls and croissants - not to mention that vile coffee - they hardly had their work cut out for them. The room was large, the bathroom enormous but the shower managed to spray water everywhere despite my attempts to adjust it. The hotel is on a very busy street but thankfully the windows shut out the noise really well so you're not…

title: Don't stay here
review: The walls in this hotel are paper thin.  I specifically asked for a quiet room and was given one away from the street.  However, when one uses the key card to enter a room, it makes a very loud buzzing sound.  I was awakened each time a neighbor opened their hotel room (which was all hours of the night).  The double rooms are tiny and not really appropriate for more than one person if they want to stand up at the same time (similar to a small cruise ship cabin).  If one moves the furniture to move around the bed, it makes a loud screeching sound on the tile floor, which can also be heard in neighboring rooms.  The mattresses have plastic fasteners that poke out.  In the bathroom the sink is also directly in front of the toilet, so you have to sit sideways (and I'm only 5 feet…

title: Good location, poor service
review: We stayed in July was a great location about a 5 minute walk from the dome. The workers on reception were quite miserable and not very helpful. The room looked nothing like the pictures in the website, very small and dark and quire drab. Breakfast was basic but ok.  You probably could get a cheaper budget  hotel that's cleaner and better looking if you shopped around!

title: Central and Quiet
review: We were checked in nice and quickly and found that our room was very spacious. It even had a small 2 seater couch in the corner! The rooms were quiet and we didn't have any issues with the air conditioner. The shower though was barely a shower, it was more of a tap dribbling. It definitely wasn't the best shower I've ever had. Luckily, staying in Summer and being hot you can put up with minimal water. But if I was staying in winter, it would be a very cold shower.  The hotel is very close to the train station and a 10 minute walk into the centre of Florence.  The check in staff were polite and very helpful. Breakfast was minimal and they some how ran out of forks very quickly.  Nice quiet hotel to use as a base for exploring the city.

title: Anywhere but Here
review: The owner turned off the AC at midnight and we had to beg for it to be turned on before the regular time of 6 AM.  We also had to request that our linen be changed, they did not have mattresses covers for the bed.  Our first room was so bad( the toilet came within an inch of the wall so that we had to climb over it to get to the shower. They did give us another room since we were staying for an extended period.  The staff was great.  We booked through Avanti and never had a problem until this time.  The hotel was run on the cheap and it was not a cheap place to stay. We were not familiar with Florence and the staff was accommodating so we thought it better to stay where we were.  There was also a lot of noise.

title: great location, wonderful staff
review: I stayed here in early September for 4 nights and would definitely stay here again. The staff were all extremely friendly, spoke good English and very helpful when Air France misplaced then destroyed my luggage. Breakfast was perfectly fine, if you want a hot breakfast go to an american chain and pay a fortune. Rooms weren't huge but again, by European standards not tiny, and my bathroom was fine. The hotel is very close to the train station and the central market, and no more than 15 minutes walk to all major attractions. If you don't like walking, don't come to Florence!

title: Wonderful happy smiling reception
review: Stayed a week, but wish it was more, a family run business with really happy helpful staff. After staying in 8 hotels on a tour, it was a refreshing change to meet such polite people. Excellent location only 5 mins from station, 2 mins from the biggest market & all attractions. Small hotel but great personal service. We would definitely be happy to stay there again, as the price was also away affordable.

title: Amazing Service!
review: We were warmly greeted by the wonderful staff! They helped us find great places to eat and where to find the best bags and shoes! Close to the train station and central for all the great attractions. Great wifi, friendly staff and wonderful service! I highly recommend staying at rhe Galileo Hotel ;)

title: Beautiful City and Large Room
review: I selected the hotel based upon a recommendation in Rick Steves' guidebook.  It is only a 5 minute walk from the train station (although the sidewalk is narrow) so the location is great.  The room was large based upon any standard.  The hotel staff was friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was spartan.  The price was very reasonable so overall, I would strongly encourage you to consider this hotel when you visit Florence.

title: Nice hotel with great location and service
review: It was my second visit to Firenze and I chose Galileo hotel again because of great location and service. The location is so perfect(close to train station and to the city center) that I could go every place by walking! The size of room and bed was enough for me. Also the room was quiet at night so I could take a good rest.The air conditioning worked well. It provided clean bathroom and new towels during my stay.  The staff was super nice. They explained famous places in Firenze wih a map and recommended some great restaurants near hotel. I could use free Wifi in my room but it worked better in the lobby. The lobby had a calm atmosphere. Also I liked the furniture and pictures hung on the walls. In the morning they offer good continental breakfast too. Overall, I could relax and…

title: Good Hotel in Florence
review: My wife and i just stayed in Galileo Hotel. Staff very helpful and kind. Breakfast was ok, like the rooms. Location of the Hotel is really strategic, you can visit everything by walk. Generally we enjoyed our stay.  Andrea

title: Old room with loud air con.
review: This hotel is on the street close to the main train station. Single room is not too small but the air condition is make so much noise.  The room look pretty old.  You can hear the toilet from the room next to your room. Slow Internet .  The best part of this hotel is good location.  The bad past are very old room and the aircondotion is working well.

title: Average
review: Dear customer, We apologies you did not enjoy your stay here, the air condition noise is because the hotel is not new, but we are renewing and fixing the entire air condition system, same thing for wifi which slowness is because the room was a bit far from the lobby where the signal is the strongest, we will fix this issue too. regards the oldness of the room, we keep it on purpose because it is the tuscany style. Thank you anyway for your review.  The director.

title: Great Hotel in Great Location
review: Inconsistent presentatiob. Aircon on one night off the next. Clean rooms, good service, but communication an issue at the desk. Bookings made ok, initial welcome ok perfunctory. Noisy teen group moved in, yelled, giggled, played door buzzer tag. Noisy toilet and shower next door. Could do better with consistency, some enthusiasm and quality control

title: Average hotel in a central location
review: As a single woman, I was very happy with my stay at Galileo Hotel.  It was comfortable, had a wonderful continental breakfast, and was well located for seeing all the well-known places in Florence, including the main train station. The room was small, but comfortable, and the air conditioning cooled things down.  The staff at the front desk were kind and quite helpful in showing how to get to various places and ensuring a good stay.  Also, they recommended what ended up being my favorite restaurant, La Divina Osteria.  While the hotel has WiFi, I had to bring my laptop closer to the computer/front desk area on the first floor.  However this was not a big problem.  The price was very reasonable, and all that was necessary was provided.  I would definitely stay there again.  Judy…

title: Great hotel in a central location
review: We enjoyed our stay at Galileo. We asked for a room away from the street and it was very quiet.  Breakfast was fine (continental) and the staff were helpful. Our room was spacious. Wifi only available near reception. There are very cheap restaurants nearby. Watch for mozzies if you leave the window open.

title: Clean, convenient, charming
review: Galileo Hotel is just a 5 minute walk from the train station.  Very convenient, and over flat streets.  The staff is outstanding, helpful and knowledgable.  Nice breakfast with the package.  Rooms and beds were small (in our room at least), but totally adequate.    The hotel is within 10 minutes walk of almost all the Florence activities.    Lots of restaturants (LOTS of good restaurants aroound the hotel),  This hotel was recommended by a travel agent friend, and worth it.  Advance reservations are a must.  Totally full when we stayed and staff says this is the norm.  Great place!

title: Great location
review: Our room was spacious and clean. The staff was very gracious and helped us to book an excursion to a wine tasting in Tuscany.  Location is great but is on a noisy road and not possible to sleep with the windows open. Windows are sound proofed though. Maybe ask for a room off the street.

title: Not what we expected
review: We checked into the hotel on a hot day (room temperature was 26 degrees) and wanted to ring reception to ask about the air conditioning ... but the phone didn't work. So we went down to the desk and asked for help in getting the air conditioning to work, but were told that we were between seasons so the heating had been turned off and air conditioning not yet turned on from the central controls. This made sleeping at night near impossible as we had the choice of melting in our beds or having the window open and being kept awake by passing merry-makers or bin lorries! Room 115 was 'cosy' (i.e. small) with minimal wardrobe space and no drawers or shelves for clothes. There was a room safe, but someone had obviously made off with the mini bar that should have been in the room.…

title: Primitive Hotel Room
review: I was so unhappy about our stay at this hotel, I emailed the booking agency we used to complain and  a copy of my complaint which covers the facts is below:  "I have just returned from a 3 day break in Florence, having booked our hotel accommodation through you. I would like to know how to make a complaint about this 3 star??? hotel as it did not meet the standards I expected when I booked it: When we arrived at the hotel, we checked into our room which I would best describe as primitive!  The room was very small and there was insufficient storage space for our clothes, so we had to live out of our suitcase’s. There was a very small ancient wooden wardrobe with 4 coat hangers which was all you could fit in it. There were no other drawers for clothing. It was hot and stuffy, so I…

title: Average hotel
review: This 2 star hotel was quite good. Clean, large room, big bathroom and free breakfast each day from 7:30 to 9:30.  There was a safe in the room (that didn't work), a small fridge and a wardrobe to hold both hanging and folded clothes as well as a very light power blow dryer in the bathroom. The area was sooooo noisy! Given the proximity to bars and a 2 minute walk from the train station, the motorcycle and pedestrian noise was immense.  Its as if the noise traveled up from the street and bounced off the buildings into your room.....even though your window was closed!  I'm a heavy sleeper and I was constantly woken up, so beware.

title: Only good location
review: There is no internet connection despite the advertising of free wifi. The lobby was filthy with dust that look like it has never been clean. The shower was clogg. You take a shower in a pool of water. Heating and cooling system in ou room and whole hotel was freezing. I went to the front desk because our phone was not working, they told me i needed to ask for heat,,because they had the control from the front desk. Free breakfast was ok. Very simple. Old pillows, very small rooms. The only good thing was the location. Near train and most sites.

title: Nice stay in Florence
