review: The staff is amazing, Stefano at the reception knows everything about Florence, best spots, restaurants and he also planned a trip outside in Tuscany!!! Room is simple but clean, the bathroom was a little small. Breakfast was great like a traditional Italian breakfast. Position is very close to Duomo and the station, we walked all the time. To sum up, great value for money!!

title: Very cute hotel in the middle of Florence
review: I stayed at this hotel in January for 2 nights with my family, the position was supernice, close to the station and to the Duomo. The staff welcomed us very warmly and gave us a lot of info for visiting around and places to eat. Our room was quite small but clean, and I liked the style: traditional and simple. I really recommend it if you want to stay in a Florence-style hotel without spending too much.

title: Really great location. Nice clean rooms.
review: Great location. Walking distance to a lot. Breakfast typical. Staff friendly and helpful. Street view was good for some people watching. Busy street but not noisy...except for sirens of course.....would revisit.

title: Good location, decent value, but...
review: Windows were opened by cleaners during the day on a day that was forecast for heavy storms. Due to the small rooms (which there is enough space to survive) our luggage was saturated.  Thinking it wa an honest mistake and in need for some towels or similar to dry things we asked at reception, where the grumpy old man offered no apology and huffed and sighed when towels or something to dry the water was asked for.  We booked a day trip with some of the female staff who were very friendly and helpful, as our pickup for the trip was early we were told we could get breakfast early. However arriving with 2 other couples that morning we had the pleasure of the grumpy old man who would not let us eat breakfast at the previously arranged time.  There was mold/grime in the bathroom and…

title: Good Hotel
review: We stayed in Galileo few months ago. My girlfriend and me just stopped here for one. I have to say that our stay there was really good. The hotel is very close from the train station and the staff was helpful. The room was a standard room with the essential things for a three star hotel.

title: A friendly and warm place.
review: I was on trip with my family, we got a big nice room and the receptionists were lovely. Breakfast was not wonderful, but reasonable for a three stars. I think small hotels like this one are warmer and more friendly than big hotels.

title: Very good value for money.
review: Having come from Venice, the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff was a pleasant surprise. They helped us find a way to break our lock after we lost the key to our bags late at night. Nothing was too much of an ask. They booked our tours and arranged for hotel pick ups. They even gave us vouchers for dinner. Breakfasts were pleasent and included in the price. Overall excellent value and a great location just near the Santa Maria Novella station.

title: Disappointed
review: I would not return to this hotel. We were in the middle of a heat wave and they kept turning off the air conditioners in the rooms. We returned from day tour late in the afternoon to find our room sweltering - air conditioner turned off - and the window unable to be opened. The staff were manipulating the air conditioners in the room from a computer at the front desk. I demanded the air conditioner in our room be turned back on. The breakfast was extremely poor. The toast bread was the thinnest white sliced bread you have ever seen and stale. The rooms were very ordinary and no linen changed. No card was left in the room to request linen be changed.

title: Does not showcase Florence
review: Customer service was very rude - our booking had apparently not been received, staff were unhelpful and not welcoming.  When we finally checked in, the air conditioning in our room did not work (- when we complained, we were given a fan) the bathroom was stained with mould.  Not a pleasant experience - do not stay here.  The location, while close to the hotel is unsafe and certainly does not showcase the best of Florence.

title: Worst hotel ever
review: The room was small dirty and very smelly, the smell in the lift made us gag, the bathroom was tiny dirty and mouldy the filth on the plastic screen and shower curtain was digusting. Room at night was 28 degrees air conditioning was turned off for enviromental reasons couldnt open the window as street so noisey. Bed was hard and uncomfortable like sleeping on an ironing board top cover was dirty, curtain hanging off rail, wordrobe smelt like someone had urinated in it, hair dryer held together with sticky tape. breakfast was meagre orange juice served in plastic cups, toast, a few stale cakes some bits of fuit. How this hotel has a three star rating is beyond me it is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in and ruined our time in Florence.

title: Do not go here worst hotel of our trip
review: Old,dated dark and dingy. The first room we were given was dusty and dirty, seems like it had not been used for a while and was not even prepared for us coming, layers so dust. The hallway was dark with stained yellowing shades. We asked re zircon as the room was stuffy and when window open very noisy, was told that it was illegal to puton air cooler in Florence until june, what the!! Offered courtyard room so we could get air, I do not think these people know what a courtyard is!! Next doors Dirty rooftop, littered and stray cats, not a courtyard to get out on. Breakfast was poor and room cramped, worst hotel we stayed in all trip, do yourself a favour. The reception staff very nice,they should go some where else, as too good for that place.

title: Great Location, Nice Rooms
review: We found this hotel in Rick Steves book. This hotel is within walking distance to the train station, convenient to restaurants and all the sites. We chose the superior room which was not ready when we arrived but the manager quickly provided another that was facing the rear courtyard. Room was quiet and clean had queen bed and large enough to move around. Breakfast was basic but good. The hotel value here was very good for the location.

title: Not impressed
review: We arrived at the Galileo Hotel after traveling all night.  The room wasn't available, but the receptionist was nice enough.  The room was tiny and the bed and pillows were of the lowest quality. We didn't know how to operate the lights and had to ask the receptionist as we weren't given the information upon arrival.  The wallpaper was coming off the wall and one could hear the plumbing in the next room.  It was very warm and we couldn't leave the windows open at night because the room faced the street.  We were told that the a/c doesn't get turned on until June 1 in Florence.  The breakfast was adequate; the dining area small.  The staff was friendly.  I would not recommend this hotel and wished we could have begun our trip to Italy in a nicer hotel and better location.  The…

title: Noisey and moldy
review: My husband and I did a tour of Italy for our one year wedding anniversary. We stayed at the Galileo for two nights. Here's the good and the bad:  Good: - about a 5 min walk from Santa Maria station - lots of restaurants and gelato places around (highly recommend Trattoria Bondi, and the restaurant beside the hotel is good too) - walking distance to the Duomo, Galleria dell'Accademia, and shopping - supermarket and laundromat across the street  Bad - bathroom had mold all along the shower - the a/c didn't work, front desk said it doesn't turn on until June - you can hear other guests shower, flush, and have conversations in their room - the room entry system emits a loud buzzing sound that you can hear other guests enter their room - breakfast consisted of just cold bread and…

title: Terrible experience
review: We were scheduled to stay here for 4 nights by a travel agent.  We left after only one night. The first room we were given already had someone in it.  The second one was so bad we complained about the moldy shower curtain, tiny bathroom (3 feet wide by 10 feet long), poor lighting and being located right beside the first floor gathering room. The staff tried very hard to accommodate us, but they can't control the high school kids who were banging doors, talking loudly in the hallways, or the loud music coming from the apartments across the street. The neighborhood feels dangerous. There are groups of  men crowded onto the sidewalks. They make you push your way thru them, as they won't move.  By 1 am we still hadn't had any peace and quiet, and they were expecting another full…

title: Florence amazing city and amazing hotel!
review: My family and i went to Florence in June to spend some time in contact with art. We found this hotel that was very close to the centre , that's very comfortable. The rooms were very clean and they have the needful things for a family. The staff was very kind and helpful, they answer every question we made. The breakfast is a  buffet breakfast and it was good. They also have italian espresso and cappuccino!  Florence left me a good impression , i wish i could spend more time in Florence and in the hotel but i had to go back to work.

title: Huge room
review: This was in Rick Steve's book, so I booked it based on that. Unfortunately, in his newer version of the book, he refers to the area as "sketchy". The hotel is just blocks from the train station and very close to the Accademia where David is located. We liked that the room was huge as was the bath. But it's difficult to take a shower without making the whole bathroom wet because there wasn't  a curtain or doors. We liked there was a convenience store around the corner as we bought bottles of water everyday, cookies and milk once. The hotel is a bit dated, and the breakfasts are very basic.

title: Wonderful and Excellent staff
review: We had booked this hotel through a travel agent after reading its reviews on Tripadvisor.com. After Rome B&B  Debacle, we were quite Skeptical about florence as it was our next destination but it turned out to be okay. Lets check the good points first - The hotel staff is charming and helpful to a fault. It is centrally located (walking distance from the station and the Duomo) and also houses brochures which offers variety of tours for Florence and neighouring cities in Tuscany, the staffe also helps you to choose them. It was value for money as it costed us 69 Euros a night +tax. Negative - the airconditioning was not working when we entered but the staff was helpful in rectifying that,even though it gave us problems over the next few days we stayed. The internet in room was…

title: Very disappointing
review: We had saved up for a long time to visit Florence. We went into our room and the air conditioning did not work. We spoke to the staff who checked the computer and said it was working. They gave us a fan and said it was a hot night. The heat became more unbearable and we complained again and were told that, according to the computer, it was working. Eventually we asked a receptionist to accompany us into our room and she agreed that it was too hot. She promptly disappeared downstairs and we had to go and ask what what being done after nothing happened.   We were moved from a double room to a single room where the air con worked. However, when it was switched on the noise was unbelievable. We were told it would rattle for about twenty minutes. it did settle a little, but was…

title: Very nice hotel!
review: the hotel is located about 10 minute walk from the central train station. the rooms are not so big comparing to other hotels i'v been in, but they are very clean. breakfest was nice, including coffee, pastry,cereals, fruits.... though the dining room was a part of the lobby. i had no trouble sleeping there though i do remember construction noises late at night and early at the morning, i would not recomend it for people who can hear everything while they sleep.

title: Wonderful hotel and service - loved it!
review: This hotel was the best one we had stayed at in Italy. The hotel is neat, pretty and clean. The receptionist Francesca is a honey and she was so helpful with anything we asked her, even with helping track down my lost luggage. The other receptionist (a young asian guy) was also very friendly and helpful. There's a guest computer with free internet and the breakfast was good. You also get a special if you stay from Sunday to Tuesday, Monday is free! It is also close to the train station and museums/markets so very convenient This hotel was great value for money and exceeded my expectations.

title: Basic but not that good
review: They gave us the room for the handicapped.  It was spacious but so dimly lighted we could hardly see to read anything or do anything easily.  The bathroom was very large and adequate.  The windows looked out on the piping area so there was only enough light to let in that showed whether it was day or night.  The air conditioning worked during our stay but one day it did have to be worked on.  The breakfast provided was okay, nothing special....typical continental breakfast.  There was one desk clerk, an older man, who was a bit brusque.  The Wi-Fi wasn't free and actually expensive and of course didn't work on our 2nd floor room anyway.  The street it's located on was very narrow and dirty.  This was not a favorite room for us though was in a pretty good location. There were no…

title: We have enjoyed it for the third time
review: The Galileo Hotel in Florence is close to train station and San Lorenzo outdoor market.  It is about 5 minute walk to everything.  The rooms are abit small, but enough room for the amount of time you are in them.  The breakfast could use some fruit, but is enough.  I enjoy talking to the staff, Gorigo is the best!  I will stay there again.

title: Conveniently situated, decent property
review: The main advantage of this hotel is it's close proximity to the main train station, which is about a five minute walk away.  The property is well maintained and rooms were comfortable and reasonably priced.  When we were there it was quite hot but the air conditioning wasn't working -- something about a filter requiring changing which I couldn't quite understand -- but fortunately the night cooled down and the room was very pleasant.  I'd be sure to ask for a room NOT facing the main road as it will be pleasantly quiet.  Nothing is that far away in Florence and we could make it to the heart of the city in a 5-10 minute walk.  Breakfast was fine, nothing extravagant.

title: Great centrally located hotel
review: My mom and I were greeted warmly by the hotel staff, they carried our bags, showed us around our room and it was great.  But then we realized there was a lot of street noise and that would be a problem.  We called the front desk and were told someone would be up soon.  A few minutes later, there was  knock on the door, and staff was there to show us another room, carried our things there, and made sure the room was to our liking, which it very much was.  It was bigger and had a private balcony.  We asked about a price difference and they said, "not to worry, it is the same price."  We were very pleasantly surprised that we had such quick service, had a lovely room and it didn't cost any more.  The staff was always so helpful in guiding us where we wanted to go, breakfast was…

title: The most amazing staff
review: I stayed at the Galileo Hotel for 3 nights. After many travel plans going wrong I needed an additional 4 nights. Though they were completely booked the amazing man at the front desk, Vincenzo, found a way to extend my stay for one night and then personally called several hotels with the same price range to find me a place to stay. I didnt even ask, I was planning to take care of it on the computer in the lobby but without hesitation he found me a place to stay within just a few minutes. The friendly front desk staff and beautiful facilities have made me wish I could stay here for the entire duration of my trip. After almost too much traveling and finding the majority of my hotel experiences disappointing, the Galileo Hotel has been an extremely refreshing experience and I would…

title: An enjoyable trouble free stay in the centre of Florence
review: Staying at this hotel was the best decision we made for our stay in Florence. It is central, short walk to the station and in the middle of everything. The room was basic with all you would need, towels changed every day, adequete and plentyful breakfast but the best of it all was the staff. Extremely helpfull in every way possible, we never felt that we were any trouble to them no matter how simple or complex our requests. We were far away from home and the airline had misplaced one of our suitcases, phone calls were made for us (we didn't speak Italian) and the pressure was eased. A wonderful stay thanks to Hotel Galileo and its staff.

title: A really nice place to stay!
review: The hotel is really close to the station and a really good spot to get to the main attractions in Florence, we stayed in a double room, which was clean and comfortable. The staff desk was kind and gave us a lot of information about restaurants and attractions nearby. I really liked the furniture of the room, which was simple but traditional. The breakfast buffet was basic, but good because included in the price. If i will be back to Florence, i will definitely stay here again.

title: Dirtiest hotel ever.
review: The room was booked by a travel agency.  Had to be moved three times because the rooms were dirty--mold & mildew in bath, dust & cobwebs on walls and ceiling, linens old and holey, mattress with buttons had no pad mattress pad, etc.  The desk staff was young, inexperienced and unprofessional.  Finally moved to a handicapped room which was cleaner but so small that the closet door couldn't be opened because it hit the bed, and the door to the room couldn't be opened all the way because it hit a small chair.  The location was near the train station on very busy, noisy street.   Unable to understand a 3-star rating for this hotel?

title: Basic, not good
review: We picked this hotel because it is near the conference centre, and also near the old centres of Florence, so we could walk everywhere. However, the air conditioning was wonky (and had a sort of "you break it, you pay" sign on the switch), the wifi (not free) was only in the upstairs common area (used by the chambermaids so not so inviting) or in the breakfast area (where I found a single plug). Not good for 2 consultants travelling together! They really need to replace their pillows. Some of the desk staff are moderately helpful.    We didn't eat there, but at the corner cafe next door.

title: Worst hotel during 12 day Italy stay
review: Close to train station but Via Nazionale is not a pleasant intro to Florence.  Room and bath were big but that's it.  Atmosphere of room was so overwhelmingly depressive that we hated to return.  Breakfast was bad.  Day staff very brusque, almost rude.  Night gentleman very pleasant.  Out of 7 hotels in Italy (2 and 3 stars), this was by far the worst and made our Florence stay unpleasant.

title: A basic hotel that will serve all your needs.
review: I didnt stay there during high tourist season, and hence, my room rate was really reasonable.  Its a hotel that will serve your basic needs....my room was big, though the windows opened up to a rather nondescript view of the ventilation system.  The toilet was extremely spacious.  Loved it  Breakfast was really basic.  Just cereals and some breads and some other stuff.  My father did open a cup of yoghurt to find that it was already spoilt and watery.  Which was a turn off but i guess it did not bother me.    The hotel is clean and comfortable, though there is a slight musky smell.  Nevertheless, you could say it has a charming atmosphere.  Its location is great too.  Next to the san lorenzo leather market and near the train station.  Dragging your luggage to the hotel from the…

title: Galileo Hotel at Rome, Italy - Nice Place to Stay
review: 1) Location is very convenient - it's a 10-minute walk to Termini train station.  We (2 people) were hauling 1 big and 2 carry-on luggage with no problem to the Termini station to catch Lenardo Express to the Airport or to catch Euro Star train to other cities.    2) The property is renovated.  The room has a lot of recessed lights and quite roomy in European standard.  3)The breakfast is good quality.  It has ham and cheese, boiled brown eggs, bread, yogurt,cereals, tea, fresh juices or coffee.  It's quite a good breakfast considering the food that were offered.    4) Location is very safe.  It's close to two embassies, German and Turkey and hence you'll see 3 soldiers in an armored car with machine guns stationed outside of the embassies 24 hours a day.  I don't think there…

title: Overall not very good
review: Good things: very well located right in the centre of the city. No need to use the bus, everything is at walking distance. People in the hotel are very friendly. Bad things: The smell of the hotel was terrible. The bathroom was not properly clean. Some rooms are big but others are very small. The breakfast is one of the worst I have seen.

title: Not a nice place
review: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and couldn't wait to leave. The room we had was on the second floor on Via Nazionale and I can best describe it as depressing. I didn't have any problem with the noise from the street as I could not hear it over the noise coming from the airconditioner. The breakfast room was small and the selection was poor. The only redeeming quality was friendly staff.

title: Hotel Galileo: Great Value and Service!!
review: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hotel Galileo for four days.  The hotel was a good value and the location was very convenient (walking distance to all attractions, close to train station, safe location).  The service at the hotel (Barbara at the reception) far exceeded our expectations.  It was the great service that made our stay at Hotel Galileo so memorable.

title: Good place to stay in Florence
review: We were impressed with the size of our room, particularly its spacious bathroom--including what seemed like a luxurious bathtub (compared to other places I've stayed in Europe). The staff was friendly and very helpful--the front desk even helped us call ahead to our B & B in Cinque Terre to get directions, info, etc.   We were able to roll our suitcases there from the train station (a bit annoying on the very narrow sidewalks in Florence, but do-able), and found the location practical--particularly since Florence is small and easy to get across on foot.  My only complaint would be the oddly dingy bedspread and covering on what looked like a fold-out futon in the corner (which we didn't need/use). For the most part, this economical hotel was clean, classy and comfortable, so it…

title: Not Bad, Not Great
review: I booked this hotel after finding it in Rick Steves' Florence book.  I contacted them online and was able to reserve rooms easily through e-mail.  The hotel is within easy walking distance of the Santa Maria Novella train station, on a busy street.  Because of this, the noise at night, even with the windows closed, can be a little much.    The area of the hotel is safe, but not very picturesque.  The room and bathroom were clean and comfortable, and the staff was helpful and cheerful.  The breakfast was just okay - nothing special, but a welcome meal at the beginning of a day of sightseeing.  You can have an espresso made for you, which is a nice touch.  I would not recommend this hotel to anyone looking to spend a lot of time in the area, or to relax while in the hotel, but it…

title: Questionable Business Practices
review: I booked 5 rooms in this hotel 6 months in advance of the date( Nov) I wanted to stay there. When I was booking the hotel they resonded to my emails quite quickly. I verified the cancellation policy and provided them with my credit card. The trip had to be cancelled a few weeks later( April) and I emailed them to cancel the reservations well within the guidelines provided to me by the hotel to cancel at no charge. I was unable to get a response from them. I emailed again 4 days in a row  with no response. I know that they were receiving and reading my emails  as I have a "read receipt " from my email but they would not provide me with a cancelation confirmation. I find their  refusal to respond or provide me with a cancelation confirmation a suspious business practice and would…

title: Good Location, very clean basic hotel
review: We stayed four nights at the Hotel Galileo in Florence during March 2008. We found it to be in a great location----------we could walk to everything. The hotel was very clean which is always important to me. It's a basic hotel and the morning breakfast  was a nice way to start your day.  The price was very reasonable and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a clean, basic place to stay that's within walking distance to everything.

title: loved the room do not like hotel
review: stayed here two nights.  my family stayed in other hotels in the area.  I was the loser.  while the hotel was clean and the room and bathroom was spacious, the front desk staff was very unhelpful.   I traveled thru italy for 3 weeks and this was the only hotel that i had to pay for internet service.   There were internet cafes all over the place in Florence that charged .99 euro per hour while the hotel charged 3.00 per half hour.   my family had lap top in every room in nearby hotel.   just do not think it is right to charge for internet service.  also front desk staff very rude.  like i was bothering them.   went out and got home at 1 in the morning to find the hotel all locked up. could not get in    will i stay there again?  only if i was desperate.

title: Wonderful stay
review: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Galileo during our 2 night stay in Florence in mid Dec 2006. The hotel was further from the main train station than I expected (8 minutes walk) but it was a good hotel. The room was clean, of an adequate size and with a wonderful shower. It was not as noisy as what was mentioned in some of the other reviews, as the room had a double glazed window. Probably December was a quieter time compared to other months. In fact, I opened the window in the mornings to hear some of the traffic sounds just to remind myself that I was in the centre of Florence.  The breakfast was adequate - breads, jams, cheese, ham, juices- enough to get you going for the day. The good thing about this hotel is the free internet in the lobby - you just need to register at the…

title: good basic hotel
review: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel and found it very comfortable. It is in a good location for walking to all of the Florence sights, it is very clean, there is plenty of very hot water. Our room was a good size with plenty of space for lots of luggage. There is nothing fancy about this hotel but it is very comfortable. We didn't find the staff to be especially friendly, but were helpful when asked. We would probably stay here again.

title: Good hotel
review: Stayed here for 2 nights in March. Would recommend this hotel as it is central and close to the main station. Good value for money. A short walk to the sights. Don't miss the main meat and veg market close by, interesting stuff and cheaper than the other shops. Especially the huge olives and strawberries! Also go up the hill on the other side of the river - good view of the city. B'fast room is tiny and food is ok but for the price ,w e would recommend this hotel.

title: Tuscan Delight!
review: We stayed here for half of our two week vacation to Italy in 2004 and LOVED it!  The room was lovely, the bath was spacious (for European hotels), the staff was most helpful and it is located very close to many of the top sites.  We walked everywhere--the city is MOST navigatable on foot and we found that the walking helped us to find some of the out of the way places that we may have otherwise missed.  The breakfast is lovely--wide variety of choices and LOTS of coffee choices!    We are planning to return in May, 2006 and cannot wait!  There are several restaurants that are very good and reasonable nearby--and it is close to the city's main market.  Further, the staff was wonderful when we asked for recommendations for restaurants both nearby and across the Arno.  Excellent…

title: All we could have wanted
review: Our three nights here were thoroughly enjoyable. Benefits included a modern lift, huge luxurious bathroom, big bedroom with double glazing insuring quality sleep, nice breakfast room and helpful English-speaking staff. The location was perfect for walking to the major tourist attractions like the Uffizi, Duomo, Palazzo del Bargello, Galleria dell'Accademia, markets, restaurants and the Santa Maria Novella railway station. We will definitely stay here next time we visit Florence.
